text: I'm confused. Can you activate the Guerrillas more than once?
There’s no limit in the text so yes. You can activate it as often as you like. It’s a ‘memory’ effect since it says the next time.
Anyone know any good ways to push damage with a few large creatures through in G/W?
Apostle blessing?

What type of effect are you looking for?
Trample/Overrun effects are my first thought.
[[!Pathbreaker Ibex]], Kamahl, etc
Yeah, things like Ibex work. I have Overwhelming Stampede and Champion of Lambholt, but I'm looking for more repeatable options like Ibex
You could also go for [[lure]] effects

attachments.fallback: Lure {1}{G}{G} // Enchantment — Aura // Enchant creature // All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
attachments.text:
Enchantment — Aura
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
_It makes the insignificant conspicuous, the repulsive alluring, and the deadly irresistible._
attachments.title: Lure {1}{G}{G}

text: I do love me the Ibex.
Anyone ever found success with Dragon Throne of Tarkir?
I use it in Stitcher Geralf to give my Zombie tokens trample, which is almost impossible in mono-Blue.
I've been wanting to try it since it's repeatable but i've never seen it in play
I managed it once.
But I don’t play that deck often enough.
ah, that's a shame. was it good that once?
Oh yes. Having 8/8 zombies become 20/20 Zombies with trample tends to win games.
Now with Stitcher if I have Intruder Alarm out I can activate Stitcher and the Drago Throne Zombie more than once.
Or Fatestitcher.

You have too many friends and want less?
Dromar dragon tribal!

text: Never mind, my plan works
So you first play darkest hour, it turns everything mono black
Celestial dawn will over write your creatures to white
Then you get to explain to people about timestamps in magic!
That's what Humility is for
Which probably should be in my Edgar deck except I'm too lazy to deal with the fucked up rules questions that will inevitably occur
Then we can use things like [[magical hack]] to confuse things further
